content:
DrawingAttributes Class

Definition

Specifies the appearance of a Stroke

In this Article

public class DrawingAttributes : System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged
Inheritance
System.Object
DrawingAttributes

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Use the DrawingAttributes property to specify settings such as color, width, transparency, and the shape of the stylus tip for a Stroke.

Use the DefaultDrawingAttributes property to specify the drawing attributes for the strokes added to an InkCanvas. Only strokes that are added after the DefaultDrawingAttributes undergo change show the updated attributes. The appearance of the strokes that are already on the InkCanvas does not change.

For a list of initial property values for an instance of the DrawingAttributes class, see the DrawingAttributes constructor.

XAML Text Usage

This class is not typically used in XAML.

Constructors

DrawingAttributes()

Initializes a new instance of the DrawingAttributes class.

public DrawingAttributes ();

Remarks

The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the DrawingAttributes class.

Property Initial Value
Color Black
FitToCurve false
Height 2 device independent pixels (DIP)
IgnorePressure false
IsHighlighter false
StylusTip System.Windows.Ink.StylusTip
StylusTipTransform Identity
Width 2 DIP

Fields

MaxHeight

Specifies the largest value allowed for the stem.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height* property.

public static readonly double MaxHeight;

Remarks

Use the MaxHeight field to check whether a value is within the limits allowed for the Height property. Do this when the value comes from an unknown source, such as unconstrained user input.

MaxWidth

Specifies the largest value allowed for the stem.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width* property.

public static readonly double MaxWidth;

Remarks

Use the MaxWidth field to check whether a value is within the limits allowed for the Width property. Do this when the value comes from an unknown source, such as unconstrained user input.

MinHeight

Specifies the smallest value allowed for the stem.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Height* property.

public static readonly double MinHeight;

Remarks

Use the MinHeight field to check whether a value is within the limits allowed for the Height property. Do this when the value comes from an unknown source, such as unconstrained user input.

MinWidth

Specifies the smallest value allowed for the stem.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width* property.

public static readonly double MinWidth;

Remarks

Use the MinWidth field to check whether a value is within the limits allowed for the Width property. Do this when the value comes from an unknown source, such as unconstrained user input.

Properties

Color

Gets or sets the color of a Stroke.

public System.Windows.Media.Color Color { get; set; }
Value
Color

The color of a Stroke.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

This property is not typically used in XAML.

FitToCurve

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether Bezier smoothing is used to render the Stroke.

public bool FitToCurve { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to use Bezier smoothing to render the Stroke; otherwise false. The default is false.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

This property is not typically used in XAML.

Height

Gets or sets the height of the stylus used to draw the Stroke.

public double Height { get; set; }
Value
Double

The value that indicates the height of the stylus used to draw the Stroke.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The Height property is less than Epsilon or NaN.

Remarks

The following factors affect the height and width of a Stroke when it is rendered, but not the value of the Height property.

  • The amount of pressure applied to the stylus when the Stroke is drawn.

  • The value of the StylusTipTransform property.

    If you set the Height property to 0 device independent pixels (DIP), it is changed to 2 DIP.

XAML Text Usage

This property is not typically used in XAML.

IgnorePressure

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the thickness of a rendered Stroke changes according the amount of pressure applied.

public bool IgnorePressure { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to indicate that the thickness of the stroke is uniform; false to indicate that the thickness of a rendered Stroke increases when pressure is increased. The default is false.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

This property is not typically used in XAML.

IsHighlighter

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the Stroke looks like a highlighter.

public bool IsHighlighter { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to render the Stroke as a highlighter; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

When the IsHighlighter property is set to true, the Stroke is slightly transparent, which allows the strokes underneath to appear.

XAML Text Usage

This property is not typically used in XAML.

StylusTip

Gets or sets the shape of the stylus used to draw the Stroke.

public System.Windows.Ink.StylusTip StylusTip { get; set; }
Value
StylusTip

One of the StylusShape values.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

This property is not typically used in XAML.

StylusTipTransform

Gets or sets the Matrix that specifies the transformation to perform on the stylus' tip.

public System.Windows.Media.Matrix StylusTipTransform { get; set; }
Value
Matrix

A Matrix that specifies the transformation to perform on the stylus' tip.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The matrix set to StylusTipTransform is not an invertible matrix.

-or-

The stem.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX* or stem.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY* property of the matrix is not zero.

Remarks

Use the StylusTipTransform property to rotate, skew, or scale the stylus tip.

XAML Text Usage

This property is not typically used in XAML.

Width

Gets or sets the width of the stylus used to draw the Stroke.

public double Width { get; set; }
Value
Double

The width of the stylus used to draw the Stroke.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The Width property is less than Epsilon or NaN.

Remarks

The following factors affect the height and width of a Stroke when it is rendered, but not the value of the Width property.

  • The amount of pressure applied to the stylus when the Stroke is drawn.

  • The value of the StylusTipTransform property.

    If you set the Width property to 0 device independent pixels (DIP), it is changed to 2 DIP.

XAML Text Usage

This property is not typically used in XAML.

Methods

AddPropertyData(Guid,Object)

Adds a custom property to the DrawingAttributes object.

public void AddPropertyData (Guid propertyDataId, object propertyData);
propertyDataId
Guid

The Guid to associate with the custom property.

propertyData
System.Object

The value of the custom property. propertyData must be of type Char, Byte, Int16, UInt16, Int32, UInt32, Int64, UInt64, Single, Double, DateTime, Boolean, String, Decimal or an array of these data types; however it cannot be an array of type String.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

propertyData is null.

ArgumentException

propertyDataId is an empty Guid.

-or-

propertyData is not one of the allowed data types listed in the Parameters section.

Remarks

The AddPropertyData method enables you to add custom properties to a DrawingAttributes object. This is useful when you render your own strokes and want to provide extra information.

Clone()

Copies the DrawingAttributes object.

public virtual System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes Clone ();
Returns
DrawingAttributes

A copy of the DrawingAttributes object.

Remarks

The Clone method creates a new DrawingAttributes object and populates it with the same values as the current object. Any custom properties are also copied.

ContainsPropertyData(Guid)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified property data identifier is in the DrawingAttributes object.

public bool ContainsPropertyData (Guid propertyDataId);
propertyDataId
Guid

The Guid to locate in the DrawingAttributes object .

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified property data identifier is in the DrawingAttributes object; otherwise, false.

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified DrawingAttributes object is equal to the current DrawingAttributes object.

public override bool Equals (object o);
o
System.Object

The DrawingAttributes object to compare to the current DrawingAttributes object.

Returns
Boolean

true if the objects are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two DrawingAttributes objects are equal if the following properties are equal:

  • Color
  • StylusTip
  • StylusTipTransform
  • Width
  • Height
  • IgnorePressure
  • FitToCurve
  • IsHighlighter
Note

The Equals method does not check the custom properties for equality.

GetHashCode()

Serves as a hash function for a particular type.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

A hash code for the current Object.

GetPropertyData(Guid)

Gets the value of the custom property associated with the specified Guid.

public object GetPropertyData (Guid propertyDataId);
propertyDataId
Guid

The Guid associated with the custom property to get.

Returns
System.Object

The value of the custom property associated with the specified Guid.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

propertyDataId is not associated with a custom property of the DrawingAttributes object.

Remarks

Use the GetPropertyData method to access custom properties you added to a DrawingAttributes object. GetPropertyData returns the default value for the built-in property if a value has not been set.

GetPropertyDataIds()

Returns the GUIDs of any custom properties associated with the StrokeCollection.

public Guid[] GetPropertyDataIds ();
Returns
Guid[]

An array of type Guid that represents the property data identifiers.

Remarks

The GUIDs for the built-in properties of the DrawingAttributes class are in the DrawingAttributeIds class.

OnAttributeChanged(PropertyDataChangedEventArgs)

Raises the AttributeChanged event.

protected virtual void OnAttributeChanged (System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs e);
e
PropertyDataChangedEventArgs

A PropertyDataChangedEventArgs that contains the event data.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

e is null.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.

The OnAttributeChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnPropertyChanged(PropertyChangedEventArgs)

Occurs when any DrawingAttributes property changes.

protected virtual void OnPropertyChanged (System.ComponentModel.PropertyChangedEventArgs e);
e
PropertyChangedEventArgs

EventArgs

OnPropertyDataChanged(PropertyDataChangedEventArgs)

Raises the PropertyDataChanged event.

protected virtual void OnPropertyDataChanged (System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs e);
e
PropertyDataChangedEventArgs

A PropertyDataChangedEventArgs that contains the event data.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

e is null.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.

The OnPropertyDataChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event.

RemovePropertyData(Guid)

Removes the custom property associated with the specified Guid.

public void RemovePropertyData (Guid propertyDataId);
propertyDataId
Guid

The Guid associated with the custom property to remove.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

propertyDataId is not associated with a custom property of the DrawingAttributes object.

Events

AttributeChanged

Occurs when a property in the DrawingAttributes object changes.

public event System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventHandler AttributeChanged;

PropertyDataChanged

Occurs when property data is added or removed from the StrokeCollection.

public event System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventHandler PropertyDataChanged;

Operators

op_Equality(DrawingAttributes,DrawingAttributes)

Determines whether the specified DrawingAttributes objects are equal.

public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes first, System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes second);
first
DrawingAttributes

The first DrawingAttributes object to compare.

second
DrawingAttributes

The second DrawingAttributes object to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the objects are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two DrawingAttributes objects are equal if the following properties are equal:

  • Color
  • FitToCurve
  • Height
  • IgnorePressure
  • IsHighlighter
  • StylusTip
  • StylusTipTransform
  • Width
Note

The Equality method does not check the custom properties for equality.

op_Inequality(DrawingAttributes,DrawingAttributes)

Determines whether the specified DrawingAttributes objects are not equal.

public static bool op_Inequality (System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes first, System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes second);
first
DrawingAttributes

The first DrawingAttributes object to compare.

second
DrawingAttributes

The second DrawingAttributes object to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the objects are not equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two DrawingAttributes objects are not equal if the following properties are not equal:

  • Color
  • FitToCurve
  • Height
  • IgnorePressure
  • IsHighlighter
  • StylusTip
  • StylusTipTransform
  • Width
Note

The Inequality method does not check the custom properties for equality.
